item.description:
We will have a guest speaker, a professional organizer/life coach, named Sibel Babacan. She is a lovely woman who used to be a scientist and changed careers now that she has a child. I have met her personally and think she is lovely. She will present the nuts and bolts of organizing your homes/lives. This will be a small group. I am limiting this meetup to 12 people.

Here is her website. I think you will agree that she is fantastic!
www.drbeeorganizingsolutions.com

Any ideas? Please send them my way.

I am compiling questions from meetup members that I will give to our presenter.
Sample Questions:
What is your greatest challenge when it comes to de-cluttering?
How do you get yourself unstuck?
How do you organize your decluttering process?
Do you or someone else hold you accountable?
Do you have a friend who holds you accountable?
Do you speak once a week with this person?
Should I set goals for myself?
What kind of goals are realistic?
Having a messy home is getting in the way of me accomplishing my life goals, and I cannot relax at home since I have all this clutter in front of me. How should I get myself past being stuck like this?

Please help us find a space for a group of 12 people in Brookline or Newton on the T and with parking available.

This event might fill up quickly. We get a high turn out when we have a speaker at our events.

Date: May 19
Time: 7:00 pm

Location:
299 Harvard Street
Brookline, MA

IMPORTANT: If you haven't attended an event, please click on "MORE," and then "FILES" to find a document that will help you find Panera and to know where you can park. Panera is T accessible. It is a short walk from the T.


***************************************************************************
Sibel's Biography:

Sibel Babacan is the founder and the owner of Dr. Bee Organizing Solutions, a company specializes in organizing and life coaching services.

Sibel holds a B.S. in Engineering and Ph.D. in Biological Sciences. Prior to founding Dr. Bee Organizing Solutions, Sibel has worked in academia and corporate R&D as a researcher and supervisor. At every position Sibel has hold, she made use of her organizing and coaching skills as a mentor to undergraduate students and as a supervisor at an international food company. When asked how and why she has made a career transition, Sibel says “I have walked the talk and re-evaluated my life goals after having a family, determining where I would like to be in 10-20 years. This ultimately resulted in a career transition that is more in line with my core values, passion and skills set”.

Sibel’s formal coaching training is through Coaches Training Institute (CTI) and she follows co-active coaching principles in her life coaching practice.

Sibel has also conducted a number of workshops for non-profit organizations. These workshops were designed to teach the attendants unique skills to organize their homes, identify and prioritize their life goals, and simplify their lives.

Sibel is a member of National Association of Professional Organizers, the Organizing Authority (NAPO), NAPO- New England and Coaches Training Institute Network. She lives with her husband and daughter in Waltham, MA.
item.how_to_find_us: We will have a Meetup sign.

group.name: Tools for Decluttering, Personal Change & Goal Attainment

item.name: Meetup with Guest Speaker-Sibel Babacan-299 Harvard St., Brookline, MA
